v.v: Praise Yahweh.
Who can recount the mighty acts of Yahweh
Blessed are those who do what is right,
Call me to mind, Yahweh, when you show favor to your people;
Then I will see the prosperity of your chosen,
We have sinned like our ancestors;
Our fathers did not appreciate your marvelous deeds in Egypt;
Nevertheless, he saved them for his name’s sake
He rebuked the Sea of Reeds, and it dried up.
He saved them from the hand of those who hated them,
But the waters covered their adversaries;
Then they believed his words,
But they quickly forgot what he had done;
They had insatiable cravings in the wilderness,
So he gave them what they requested,
In the camp they became jealous of Moses
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan
Fire broke out among them;
They made a calf at Horeb
They traded the glory of God
They forgot God their Savior,
He had done wonderful things in the land of Ham
So he said he would destroy them—
Then they despised the fruitful land;
but grumbled in their tents,
Therefore he raised his hand and swore to them
scatter their descendants among the nations,
They worshiped the Baal of Peor
They provoked him to anger with their actions,
Then Phinehas rose to intervene,
It was counted to him as a righteous deed
They also angered Yahweh at the waters of Meribah,
They made Moses bitter,
They did not destroy the nations
but they mingled with the nations
and worshiped their idols,
They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.
They shed innocent blood,
They were defiled by their deeds;
So Yahweh was angry with his people,
He gave them into the hand of the nations,
Their enemies oppressed them,
Many times he came to help them,
Nevertheless, he paid attention to their distress
He called to mind his covenant with them
He caused all their conquerers
Save us, Yahweh, our God.
May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
Let the redeemed of Yahweh speak out,
He has gathered them out of foreign lands,
They wandered in the wilderness on a desert road
Because they were hungry and thirsty,
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
He led them by a direct path
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
For he satisfies the longings of those who are thirsty,
Some sat in darkness and in gloom,
This was because they had rebelled against God’s word
He humbled their hearts through hardship;
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
He brought them out of darkness and gloom
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
For he has broken the gates of bronze
They were foolish in their rebellious ways
They lost their desire to eat any food,
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
He sent his word and healed them,
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving
Some travel on the sea in ships
These saw the deeds of Yahweh
For he commanded and aroused the windstorm
They reached up to the sky; they went down to the depths.
They swayed and staggered like drunkards
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,
He calmed the storm,
Then they rejoiced because the sea was calm,
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people
He turns rivers into a wilderness,
and a fruitful land into a barren place
He turns the wilderness into a pool of water
He settles the hungry there,
They build a city to plant fields in, to plant vineyards,
He blesses them so they are very numerous.
They were diminished and brought low
He pours contempt on the leaders
But he protects the needy from affliction
The upright will see this and rejoice,
Whoever is wise should take note of these things

v: Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
or proclaim in full all his praiseworthy deeds?
and whose deeds are always just.
help me when you save them.
rejoice in the gladness of your nation,
and glory with your inheritance.
we have done wrong, and we have done evil.
they ignored your many acts of covenant faithfulness;
they were rebellious at the sea, the Sea of Reeds.
so that he might reveal his power.
Then he led them through the depths, as through a wilderness.
and he rescued them from the hand of the enemy.
not one of them survived.
and they sang his praise.
they did not wait for his instructions.
and they challenged God in the desert.
but he sent a horrible disease upon them.
and Aaron, the holy priest of Yahweh.
and covered the followers of Abiram.
the fire consumed the wicked.
and worshiped a cast metal figure.
for the image of a bull that eats grass.
who had done great deeds in Egypt.
and mighty acts at the Sea of Reeds.
had not Moses, his chosen one, stood in the breach before him,
to turn away his anger from destroying them.
they did not believe his promise,
and did not obey Yahweh.
that he would let them die in the desert,
and scatter them in foreign lands.
and ate the sacrifices offered to the dead.
and a plague broke out among them.
and the plague subsided.
to all generations forever.
and Moses suffered because of them.
and he spoke rashly.
as Yahweh had commanded them,
and learned their ways
which became a snare to them.
the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
desecrating the land with blood.
in their actions they were like prostitutes.
and he despised his own people.
and those who hated them ruled over them.
and they were brought into subjection to their authority.
but they kept rebelling
and were brought low by their own sin.
when he heard their cry for help.
and relented because of his steadfast love.
to have pity on them.
Gather us from among the nations
so that we may give thanks to your holy name
and glory in your praises.
from everlasting to everlasting.
All the people said, “Amen.”
Praise Yahweh.
